issues.description: Return-type mismatch for Stock.take(String): The problem statement's UML specifies take(String): int (problem_statement.md), and the solution implements take returning an int (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Stock.java). However, the template implements take(String) returning boolean (template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Stock.java). This structural mismatch will confuse students and cause compilation errors when they try to follow the specification (and the solution) because code that expects an int sentinel value (e.g., comparing to -1) will not compile against the template's boolean signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template implementation of Stock.take(String) to return an int and adopt the same semantics as in the problem specification and solution: return -1 when the ingredient is missing or out of stock, otherwise decrement the quantity and return the new quantity. Concretely, change the method signature in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Stock.java from 'public boolean take(String ingredient)' to 'public int take(String ingredient)' and implement the same return values/logic as in the solution.
